definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
lit. to jump out of a fire pit (idiom); to escape from a living hell/to free oneself from a life of torture
out of the frying pan into the fire (idiom)
pinyin: tiao4 chu1 fu3 di3 jin4 huo3 keng1

sentences.english: I can't open my eyes to watch you jumping into the fiery pit, for I will shut my eyes at the time.
sentences.chinese: 我不會眼睜睜看着你往火坑裏跳，到時候我會閉上的。

sentences.english: Out of the frying-pan into the fire.
But now, I seem to have gone from the frying pan into the fire.
sentences.chinese: 可我現在感覺，自己是剛出油鍋，又進火坑。

sentences.english: I think I've jumped out of the frying-pan into the fire by changing jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我調動工作真是跳出釜底進火坑。

sentences.english: Don't you realize we've jumped out of the frying pan into the fire?
sentences.chinese: 你難道不明白我們這是跳出了油鍋卻掉進火坑了嗎？

sentences.english: You may jump from the frying pan into the fire if you make a move today.
sentences.chinese: 如果今天擅自行動，結果是你跳出泥潭跳入火坑。

sentences.english: Fully finished back yard has built-in BBQ, fire pit and gorgeous flowers.
sentences.chinese: 全面完成後院有內置的燒烤，火坑和絢麗的花朵。

sentences.english: And when the tail led, the snake fell into a burning pit and was burnt to its death.
sentences.chinese: 放尾在前，即墮火坑，燒爛而死。

sentences.english: Liars of terrible devotion, caverns of virgins, ferocious places.
sentences.chinese: 殘忍的苦行窟，處女們的火坑，蠻不講理的地方。

sentences.english: After the wheat flour ferments, people bake them in a specially-designed fire pit.
sentences.chinese: 將小麥麪粉發酵後，在特製的火坑中烤熟。

sentences.english: Should you like to fall into that pit full of fire?
They are pouring money into putting into the fire out, when they would like to doing, building brand new buildings.
sentences.chinese: 他們在把本來應該在建築新的建築的錢扔進了火坑。

definition: to jump into a well (to drown oneself, esp. of ladies in fiction)
lit. to jump out of a fire pit (idiom); to escape from a living hell/to free oneself from a life of torture
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
to harm sb/to inflict suffering/to victimize/pernicious
lit. a lamb in a tiger's den (idiom)/fig. to tread dangerous ground
(lit.) to splash dirty water/(fig.) to throw mud at/to smear (sb)
